text: I have developed module and listed on marketplace, but still that module is on pending status
how can I get the module published

When submitting something to the marketplace it goes through a review process on our end. We review templates/modules out of a queue with the oldest templates/modules being reviewed first. The typical time for a module/template to be reviewed is around 2 weeks but this can vary based on volume submitted. Once your module has been reviewed you'll get an email to your provider contact email address either letting you know your module was approved or with a list of required fixes.
Okay, but I have listed the module on the date 12/29/2019
Is my uploaded module reviewed or else need to do any changes

The review process typically takes around 2 weeks but can take longer depending on volume/staffing. In your listings, once the module is reviewed, it will change status to approved or unapproved. When the status changes you'll also get an email saying it was approved or if it is unapproved you'll get a list of fixes. If the module is pending it is still waiting to be reviewed by someone on our team.

Hey - was wondering what marketplace themes tend to do when it comes to the standard HubSpot modules - Do most of the themes simply create clones of the modules and change the markup to fit with their coding standards, prefix them and then instruct customers to use those?

I'd generally say that most templates use default modules where appropriate (without cloning). So for example, for a simple section with text a rich text module would likely be used. Then for anything that you can't accomplish with a standard module a custom module would be created (e.g. accordion, tabber, pricing table). If you're looking to get a sense for what other developers are doing there are also quite a few free templates on the marketplace that you could download and check out to get a sense of what people are using. Hope that helps :thumbsup:

For your custom modules - I also think prefixing makes sense if they are not intended to be used outside of your template pack. If this is specific to the new themes tool - I would recommend asking this question over in <#CSFGKSHT7|themes>

That’s helpful. It’s finding a right balance between adding css classes to wrappers/columns vs creating new row elements for very specific purposes. As it’s for a marketplace theme - I wanted to make it as simple as possible to customise, without asking the user to change classes in the design manager.

I think the HubSpot marketplace submission requirements could do with a minor tweak to make it clearer “Templates should use HubSpot’s Drag & Drop Interface.” maybe, including the fact that this is the design manager drag and drop interface? As dnd areas exist now - unless that includes this?
Hi all! anyone using Lucky Orange with their HubSpot account?
